title: Represent and analyze - compare a-max at f and 2f

content.question: Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are each attached to different springs and undergo simple harmonic motion. The blocks oscillate with the same amplitude but at different frequencies, with Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> oscillating with half the frequency of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. How do the magnitudes of the maximum accelerations <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively, compare to each other?

choices.label: <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 2 is less than one half, lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase a, sub 2 equals one half, lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half, lowercase a, sub 1 is less than lowercase a, sub 2, which is less than lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lowercase a, sub 2 equals lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="lowercase a, sub 2 is less than one half, lowercase a, sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
